bioprojects.title: Zalophus californianus (California sea lion) genome, mZalCal1, alternate haplotype
Zalophus californianus (California sea lion) genome assembly, mZalCal1

attributes.name: biomaterial_provider
attributes.value: Marine Mammal Center in Sausalito, California

biosample.biomaterialProvider: Marine Mammal Center in Sausalito, California

description.comment: As an apex marine predator, the California sea lion is an important indicator species for the impact of anthropogenic pollution on ocean health. It further serves as a physiological and evolutionary model to study mammalian aquatic adaptation, and contributes to our understanding of the genetic and environmental roles in carcinogenesis. The sample of a male individual was provided by The Marine Mammal Center in Sausalito, California, U.S.A. (Permit #MMPA 18786), and was used to generate a chromosomal level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP Project.
description.title: Animal sample from Zalophus californianus

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: California sea lion sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the alternate haplotype of the diploid genome Zalophus californianus. The principal haplotype sequences are in WGS project WPOA00000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
